Origins: In January 2015, the National Report published an article positing that singer Justin Bieber would be stepping into the shoes of the late actor Paul Walker to play the lead in the next installment of the Fast and Furious film series:
Description: Soon afterwards many social media users and web sites were sharing this article, believing it to be genuine news especially given that it came on the heels of a similar rumor started the previous month by HollywoodLife , who made a spoof video envisioning how Bieber would be taking over for Walker to complete Fast & Furious 7 (production of which had been interrupted by the latter's untimely death): However, there is no truth to any of this: The source of the article quoted above, National Report , is a fake news web site (prominently featured in our article " 5 Fake News Sites to Avoid Sharing "). The National Report 's disclaimer page notes: National Report is a news and political satire web publication, which may or may not use real names, often in semi-real or mostly fictitious ways. All news articles contained within National Report are fiction, and presumably fake news. Any resemblance to the truth is purely coincidental.
Example: [Collected via e-mail, May 2015] Is this true? "Director James Wan Announces Justin Bieber To Fill Paul Walker's Role In Fast & Furious 8"
Claim: Singer Justin Bieber will be replacing the late actor Paul Walker in the Fast and Furious film series.
